alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cumberland County through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westbrook, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portland, Westbrook, Cumberland, Gorham, Falmouth, Yarmouth, Chebeague Island and Windham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 6 and 14. Interstate 95 between mile markers 48 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Maine.
